bioghist.p: In 1803 the Reverend Samuel Preston, rector of Chevening in Kent, England, died, and left his library of twenty-five hundred volumes to the Library Company. Preston had heard of the library in 1774 from Franklin when he visited Chevening, the seat of the whiggish Earls Stanhope, but he only decided to become its benefactor while having his portrait painted by the expatriate artist Benjamin West in 1797. Les monumens de la monarchie françoise : qui comprenant l’histoire de France, avec les figures de chaque règne que l’injure des temps à épargnées is a five-volume history on the origins of the French nation and the development of its monarchy written by Bernard de Montfaucon (1655-1741), a noted scholar of antiquity.

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook of miscellaneous plates from Les monumens de la monarchie françoise by Bernard de Montfaucon, published between 1729-1733.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
